009
010package imagingbook.common.color.colorspace;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Matrix.inverse;
013import static imagingbook.common.math.Matrix.multiply;
014
015/**
016 * <p>
017 * This class represents a linear chromatic adaptation transform,
018 * mapping XYZ color coordinates from a source white (reference) point
019 * to a target white point. 
020 * Both white points are passed to the constructor.
021 * The actual color mapping is done by method {@link #applyTo(float[])}.
022 * The underlying linear transformation is specified by a 3x3 matrix,
023 * which may be retrieved by {@link #getAdaptationMatrix()}).
024 * See the Section 14.6 of [1] for additional details and examples.
025 * </p>
026 * <p>
027 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; 
028 * An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
029 * </p>
030 * 
031 * @author WB
032 * @version 2022/11/14
033 * @see XYZscalingAdaptation
034 */
035public class BradfordAdaptation implements ChromaticAdaptation {
036        
037        // CAT forward transform matrix from XYZ to "virtual" RGB scaling coordinates
038        private static final double[][] MCAT = {
039            { 0.8951,  0.2664, -0.1614},
040            {-0.7502,  1.7135,  0.0367},
041            { 0.0389, -0.0685,  1.0296}};
042           
043        // CAT inverse transform matrix from "virtual" RGB scaling coordinates back to XYZ
044        private static final double[][] MCATi = inverse(MCAT);    // we always invert for precision reasons
045//              {{ 0.9869929054667120, -0.1470542564209900, 0.1599626516637310}, 
046//               { 0.4323052697233940,  0.5183602715367770, 0.0492912282128560}, 
047//               {-0.0085286645751770,  0.0400428216540850, 0.9684866957875500}}
048        
049        // the complete color adaptation transformation matrix for transforming source XYZ to target XYZ,
050        // XYZ2 = Madapt * XYZ1, with
051        // Madapt = MCAT^-1 * DiagRGB * MCAT
052        private final double[][] Madapt;
053        private final double[][] Mdiag;
054        
055        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
056        
057        /**
058         * Returns a {@link BradfordAdaptation} instance for the specified
059         * white point coordinates.
060         * 
061         * @param W1 source white point (to map from)
062         * @param W2 target white point (to map to)
063         * @return a {@link BradfordAdaptation} instance 
064         */
065        public static BradfordAdaptation getInstance(double[] W1, double[] W2) {
066                return new BradfordAdaptation(W1, W2);
067        }
068        
069        /**
070         * Returns a {@link BradfordAdaptation} instance for the specified
071         * illuminants (white points).
072         * 
073         * @param illum1 source illuminant (white point to map from)
074         * @param illum2 target illuminant (white point to map to)
075         * @return a {@link BradfordAdaptation} instance
076         */
077        public static BradfordAdaptation getInstance(Illuminant illum1, Illuminant illum2) {
078                return getInstance(illum1.getXYZ(), illum2.getXYZ());
079        }
080        
081        /** Constructor (non-public) accepting two white points (XYZ-coordinates). */
082        private BradfordAdaptation(double[] W1, double[] W2) {
083                double[] rgb1 = multiply(MCAT, W1);
084                double[] rgb2 = multiply(MCAT, W2);
085                this.Mdiag = getRgbWhiteRatioMatrix(rgb1, rgb2);
086                this.Madapt = multiply(MCATi, multiply(Mdiag, MCAT));
087        }
088        
089        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
090        
091        public static double[][] getMCAT() {
092                return MCAT;
093        }
094        
095        public static double[][] getMCATi() {
096                return MCATi;
097        }
098        
099        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
100        
101        @Override
102        public float[] applyTo(float[] XYZA) {
103                // XYZB = Madapt . XYZA
104                float[] XYZB = new float[3];
105                for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
106                        XYZB[i] = (float) (Madapt[i][0] * XYZA[0] + Madapt[i][1] * XYZA[1] + Madapt[i][2] * XYZA[2]);
107                }
108                return XYZB;
109        }
110        
111        @Override
112        public double[] applyTo(double[] XYZA) {
113                // XYZB = Madapt . XYZA
114                double[] XYZB = new double[3];
115                for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
116                        XYZB[i] = Madapt[i][0] * XYZA[0] + Madapt[i][1] * XYZA[1] + Madapt[i][2] * XYZA[2];
117                }
118                return XYZB;
119        }
120        
121        /**
122         * Returns the composite color adaptation transformation matrix.
123         * @return the color adaptation transformation matrix
124         */
125        public double[][] getAdaptationMatrix() {
126                return this.Madapt;
127        }
128        
129
130        // Creates a diagonal matrix with the ratios of the rgb components
131        // obtained by transforming the two white points
132        private static double[][] getRgbWhiteRatioMatrix(double[] rgbA, double[] rgbB) {
133                if (rgbA.length != rgbB.length) {
134                        throw new IllegalArgumentException();
135                }
136                final int n = rgbA.length;
137                double[][] M = new double[n][n];
138                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
139                        M[i][i] = rgbB[i] / rgbA[i];
140                }
141                return M;
142        }
143                
144}
